title: Product Operations Lead
content:
P-924
As a Product Operations Lead, you will be part of the Product and Engineering organization, and you will drive multiple Product Lines for Databricks.
You will be an essential link between customer-facing operations teams and the product and engineering team building features used by thousands of customers.
You will partner with the Product Management, Engineering, Field teams to start. You'll help close the feedback loop by analyzing contact drivers, and collaborating with various team members to build a cohesive customer story illustrating the biggest areas for opportunities. This job involves a deep understanding of stakeholder management, and the ability to navigate an environment with passionate people intent on delivering valuable products. Applied experience with analytics and reporting is a must. You will report to the director of product operations.
The impact you will have:

Analyze and synthesize data from multiple sources, including customer and partner feedback, product usage and adoption
Develop and maintain user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc., and surface key metrics and trends to stakeholders, leveraging your expertise to call attention to the most important problems and themes
Partner with cross-functional operations teams to consult, develop and implement metrics, automated reporting/process solutions, and process improvements to meet business needs.
Influence product and engineering decision-makers to deliver the best possible customer experience, using both data and qualitative analysis to inform your perspective
Organize the measurement of key results for annual objectives. Communicate status on objective progress to department stakeholders
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data
Implement process improvements: identify operational gaps and implement them to optimize product operations processes, reducing costs and improving efficiency
Be a team player: Evangelize and uphold our cultural principles: be customer obsessed, be data-driven, team work makes the dream work, and own it.

What we look for:

6+ years of experience in a business analyst or data analyst role. Experience using SQL and Microsoft excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience building Data pipelines using SQL, Python, R, or Scala
Experience with data visualization solutions, such as Tableau, Salesforce, PowerBI, and/or Data Studio
Capable of distilling complex analysis and modeling efforts into clear messaging
Experience in the enterprise software industry, SaaS and B2B is preferred
Experience working with customer-facing support systems such as in-app help centers, customer case & form submission flows, and zero-contact resolution/self-help features
Listen well in order to drive stakeholder alignment to help reach the necessary decisions
Experience leading update syncs (strong preference for Agile/Scrum/JIRA experience)
Entrepreneurial, "can do" attitude - ability and willingness to make an impact in a start-up
Most of all, we look for relentless problem solvers and will consider candidates with non-traditional backgrounds.

Benefits

Private Medical Insurance
Private Life Insurance
Equity Awards
Paid Parental Leave
Fitness Reimbursement
Annual Career Development Fund
Home Office/Work Headphone Reimbursement
Business Travel Accident Insurance

#LI-Onsite #LI-puravidaAbout Databricks
Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
 
Compliance
If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.

questions.description:
1. Beginner:

    • I understand basic SQL syntax.
    • I can retrieve data using simple SELECT statements.
    • I know how to filter data using WHERE clauses.
    • I understand basic JOIN operations.
    • I can use GROUP BY and aggregate functions (e.g., COUNT, SUM).

  2. Intermediate:

    • I am proficient in complex SELECT statements.
    • I am comfortable using subqueries.
    • I understand and can create various types of JOINs (INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN).
    • I can create and modify tables using DDL (Data Definition Language) statements.
    • I know how to use transactions and manage database connections.
    • I am familiar with indexes and their impact on query performance.
    • I can write stored procedures, functions, and triggers.

  3. Advanced:

    • I have expertise in optimizing complex queries for performance.
    • I have mastery of database normalization and denormalization concepts.
    • I can design and implement complex database schemas.
    • I am proficient in using advanced SQL features such as window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and stored procedures.
    • I understand and can implement database security measures.
    • I am knowledgeable about database tuning and optimization.
    • I am familiar with database administration tasks (backup, restore, etc.).
    • I can work with large datasets efficiently.
questions.label: Rank your knowledge of SQL:

questions.description:
1. Beginner:

    • I have a basic understanding of the Excel interface and terminology.
    • I can navigate and input data into cells.
    • I am familiar with simple functions such as SUM, AVERAGE, and COUNT.
    • I have basic formatting skills, like changing fonts, colors, and cell alignment.
    • I know how to create basic charts.

  2. Intermediate:

    • I am proficient in data manipulation and organization, using features like sorting and filtering.
    • I am comfortable using more advanced functions like VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, and IF statements.
    • I can create and modify charts, including more complex ones like pivot charts.
    • I understand data validation and conditional formatting.
    • I have a basic knowledge of data tables and scenarios.
    • I can create and work with pivot tables.

  3. Advanced:

    • I have expertise in complex functions and formulas, including INDEX-MATCH, array formulas, and nested functions.
    • I am proficient in using advanced data analysis tools such as Goal Seek and Solver.
    • I have mastered PivotTable features, including grouping, calculated fields, and slicers.
    • I have knowledge of Excel Macros and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) for automation.
    • I can create complex charts and graphs, as well as dynamic dashboards.
    • I use advanced data validation techniques and custom formatting.
    • I understand Power Query and Power Pivot for advanced data modeling.
questions.label: Rank your knowledge of working in Excel
